Jurisdiction J Part A MAC Jurisdiction J Part B MAC Jurisdiction M Part A MAC Jurisdiction M Part B MAC Jurisdiction M Home Health and Hospice MAC CSSC Operations DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Program MolDX® National Provider Enrollment (NPE) West Pricing, Data Analysis, and Coding (PDAC) Prior Authorization RRB Specialty MAC Beneficiaries RRB Specialty MAC Providers Third Party Administrator Careers Contact Philosophy Capabilities Overview > Administrative Services Enterprise Solutions Web & Portal Development Transaction Processing Data Analytics iFlow Training Help Desk Testing Partnering Overview > OASIS Program About Overview > Contracts Leadership Board of Directors Annual Reports Happenings Community Initiatives Home About Leadership Contracts Leadership Board of Directors Annual Reports Happenings Community Initiatives Leadership Neal Burkhead President and Chief Operating Officer Bio Neal has over 25 years of leadership experience in the health care industry. During his tenure at Palmetto GBA, he has held a variety of leadership positions in operations supporting both government and commercial contracts. Neal is a graduate of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with a degree in Political Science. Before joining Palmetto GBA, he worked in health care IT for medical universities and their affiliated physician practices. Neal is active in the local community, currently serving as a Board member for Youth Corps, a Midland’s based non-profit whose mission is to support the development of leadership skills for Midland’s youth. Nella Bishop Chief Information Officer and Vice President of Systems & Support Bio Nella has close to 30 years of experience in Information Technology and Systems. As the CIO and Vice President of Systems and Support, Nella provides strategic guidance in the design and development of new technical initiatives to support Palmetto GBA’s strategic business programs. In this role, Nella has oversight responsibility for Palmetto GBA’s Systems and Support Division providing technical services for all Palmetto GBA contracts as well as directly to the Federal Government and other external business entities. In addition, Nella has responsibility for several technical contracts and Palmetto GBA’s system security program. The Palmetto GBA Systems Division consists of over 500 technicians, software engineers and architects, analysts and technical support personnel. Nella is a graduate of Columbia College with a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics and the Georgia Institute of Technology with a Master of Science in Computer Science. Before joining Palmetto GBA, Nella held a number of leadership positions in the technology industry, specifically the telecommunications and high-tech sectors. Debbie Dickson Vice President of Jurisdiction J A/B MAC Operations Bio Debbie has over 30 years of experience in Medicare contractor operations with progressive leadership responsibilities. Debbie’s area of expertise is in financial management and internal controls ensuring that an effective internal control structure over Medicare financial management operations is in place and operating effectively. She has a proven track record in successfully managing large workloads and system transitions. Debbie is the Program Manager responsible for the oversight and administration of Palmetto GBA's Jurisdiction J A/B Medicare Administrative Contractor (JJ A/B MAC) contract in the states of Alabama, Georgia and Tennessee. Debbie graduated from Francis Marion College earning a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting and is a 2010 graduate of the Leadership for the New South Columbia College’s Leadership Institute. Jennifer Dowell Assistant Vice President of Prior Authorization Programs Bio Jennifer is a Registered Nurse with over 20 years of experience in the health care field, 14 of those years in government programs to include Medicare operations and survey and certification work for state agencies. As the Assistant Vice President of Prior Authorization Programs, Jennifer oversees the Review Choice Demonstrations for Home Health and Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility services as well as the prior authorization of certain outpatient department services and repetitive non-emergent ambulance transport. Jennifer also supports the continued growth of innovative pilot opportunities within the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) contracts. Prior to joining Palmetto GBA in 2016, Jennifer’s clinical experience was focused on trauma/burn intensive care, whole organ transplant intensive care and cardiac catheterization. Jennifer received a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from the University of Alabama, received a Certificate of Leadership from Cornell University and will be a graduate of the Leadership Columbia class of 2024. Robin Free Vice President of Support Operations Bio Robin is a Registered Nurse with over 24 years of experience in the health care field, 20 of those years in Medicare operations. As Palmetto GBA’s Vice President of Support Operations, Robin oversees the Medicare Competitive Bidding Implementation contract, National Provider Enrollment (NPE) West contract, Provider Enrollment and Oversight (PEO) Eastern Region Site Verification Services, Program Improvement, and the Camden, SC Document Control Center. Prior to joining Palmetto GBA in 2003, Robin's clinical experience was focused on Home Health Case Management and inpatient orthopedic, neurological, and cardiac care. Robin received a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from Capital University in Columbus, Ohio, is a 2014 recipient of a Certificate in Leadership from the Institute for Leadership & Professional Excellence at Columbia College and a 2018 graduate of Leadership Columbia. Taliah S. Jarvis Vice President of Compliance and Privacy Bio Taliah has over 20 of experience with government contracts, ten of which have been focused on compliance and privacy programs. As Palmetto GBA’s Vice President of Compliance and Privacy, Taliah oversees and manages the Palmetto GBA Compliance group that actively encourages and enforces adherence to the corporate code of conduct and to all ethical, legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements and obligations. Taliah provides information and guidance to Palmetto GBA senior management and the Board of Directors Compliance Committee. Taliah graduated from the University of South Carolina with a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science and later a Master of Business Administration degree. Prior to joining Palmetto GBA, Taliah served as the Vice President of Compliance and Privacy at Companion Data Services. Gina Jenkins Vice President of Shared Services Bio Gina serves as the Vice President of Shared Services, where she oversees critical operations including Jurisdiction J and Jurisdiction M A/B MAC appeals, claims, and pricing functions. Additionally, she manages the Railroad Retirement Board (RRB) Specialty Medicare Contractor (SMAC) contract and the Continuing Education/Medicare Learning Network (CE/MLN) contract and DEX® Registry. Her leadership spans across teams located in South Carolina, Ohio, and Georgia. Joining Palmetto GBA in 2000 with the procurement of the RRB SMAC contract, Gina has held a series of progressively responsible roles, culminating in her position as Senior Director of RRB SMAC Operations. She holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Management from Brenau University and a Master of Business Administration from the University of South Carolina Aiken. Nancy Lybrand Vice President and Chief Financial Officer Bio Nancy has over 36 years of experience in Accounting and Financial Management. As Chief Financial Officer for Palmetto GBA, Nancy has overall responsibility for the Finance and Accounting division. This division supports all of the company’s administrative accounting functions, the business proposal functions, as well as the finance operational functions of Palmetto GBA’s large Medicare administrative services contracts. In addition, this division provides financial operations support to the BlueCross BlueShield of South Carolina’s Medicaid division. Most recently, Nancy served as the Accounting Director for Palmetto GBA for 22 years. In this role, Nancy was responsible for all financial functions regarding the budgeting, accounting, time keeping, and pricing new business proposals. Nancy is a graduate of Winthrop University earning a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting. Tim Masheck Vice President, Information Technology Services Bio Tim has over 33 years of leadership experience and has led operational as well as Information Technology business segments. For the last 24 years, Tim has been focused on Information Technology, Strategy and Financial services specializing in supporting the federal health care market. Prior to joining Palmetto GBA, Tim was the Vice President of Health Information Technology and was responsible for federal government programs. As Vice President, Information Technology (IT) Services, Tim will lead a business unit pursuing information technology and data analytics business opportunities. Tim is a graduate of Butler University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance. Additionally, he received his Master of Business Administration with concentrations in Management, Human Resources and Entrepreneurship from Indiana Institute of Technology. Margaret Price Vice President, Chief Technology Officer Bio Margaret has over 30 years’ experience providing Information Technology Services for health care, manufacturing, and education industries. In her role as the Vice President and Chief Technology Officer for Palmetto GBA, she leads the technical architecture and solutions development in support of growing and diversifying Information Technology and Data Analytics services. Prior to joining Palmetto GBA, Margaret was the Assistant Vice President of BlueCross BlueShield of South Carolina’s Infrastructure area where she lead the strategic planning, acquisition, delivery, and operations of the Network, Telephony, and Database Administration environment. Additionally, she was also responsible for the security and compliance operations teams that support government contracts and maintained the required compliance with many of the security requirements. Margaret has a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from Central Michigan University and a number of technical certifications resulting from her extensive professional training. Ed Sanchez Vice President of Jurisdiction M A/B MAC Operations Bio Ed serves as Vice President of Operations and is the Program Manager responsible for the oversight and administration of Palmetto GBA’s Jurisdiction M A/B Medicare Administrative Contract (JM A/B MAC) in the states of North and South Carolina, Virginia and West Virginia as well as the Regional Home Health and Hospice contracts for a 16-state jurisdiction. These responsibilities encompass a broad range of functions including review choice demonstration initiatives, prior authorization, claims processing, customer service, appeals, medical policy, provider enrollment, provider outreach and education, provider audit and reimbursement and medical review. Additionally, he supports organic growth expansion and innovation pilot opportunities within Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) contracts. Ed has over 39 years of professional experience and over 23 years leading Medicare Integrity Program functions in Medicare Part A/B, Home Health & Hospice and Durable Medical Equipment environments. A licensed Attorney, Ed holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics from Haverford College, a Juris Doctor from Temple University, and a Master’s in Business Administration from Drexel University. Ed also earned a master’s certification in Federal Government Contracting from George Washington University. All Categories Airports Cruise Ports Shopping Restaurants Local Attractions Theme Parks Beaches Golf Courses MLB Training Pro Sports < Prev Palmetto - Pine Country Club Welcome to Palmetto-Pine Country Club If year-round golf in warm weather and still warmer friendships is a life-style you want, Palmetto-Pine Country Club provides an atmosphere of fun and relaxation that is unique and much-valued among its members. Additionally, Forbes Magazine selected Cape Coral as one of the 25 best places to retire in 2012! For more info click here: FORBES MAGAZINE. And in April 2013, MSN Money Magazine selected Cape Coral as the No. 7 city out of the top 10 "where retirees rule." For ardent golfers, the course offers both challenge and pleasure from any of the five sets of tees. For our members who do not play golf, Palmetto-Pine Country Club offers a very active social calendar from which to choose. Let us help you discover how Palmetto-Pine Country Club can be your paradise found. Distance from Tropical Palms Villa 7.7 miles Approximate Driving Time 17 minutes Contact Info To make a tee time, please call: 239-574-2141 Banquet Manager - Charles Nagle 239-574-4711 or cnagle@palmettopinecc.com Controller - Michelle White 239-574-7262 or mwhite@palmettopinecc.com Head Golf Professional - Brady Fennel, PGA 239-574-2141 or bfennel@palmettopinecc.com Membership Director - Ashley Sanders Office: 239-574-7262 Ext.27 Cell: 239-895-8070 or asanders@palmettopinecc.com 1940 S.W. 9th Court Cape Coral, FL 33991 Official Website Tropical Palms Villa Copyright © 2025. When was Palmetto-Pine Country Club founded? Palmetto-Pine Country Club was founded in 1969 . Palmetto-Pine Country Club Hospitality United States 11-50 Employees Palmetto-Pine Country Club is a semi-private, equity owned club located in Cape Coral, Florida. Since 1969, Palmetto-Pine has been the staple of Cape Coral providing championship golf and a host of dining and social activities for its members and guests.

Our championship golf course designed by renowned architect, Arthur Hills, provides a fair yet challenging test of golf for players of all abilities from one of our eight sets of tees. In addition, our greens are known as some of the best in the area, smooth and fast!

For the dining and social enthusiast, we have a full-service restaurant, bar and social calendar throughout the year. Whether it's a quick bite after golf or dinner with family and friends, we have you covered! If you searching for a venue to host a large private party, we can accommodate up to 225 patrons in our banquet facilities as well!

Come visit Palmetto-Pine Country Club and enjoy everything we have to offer! Since 1969, Palmetto-Pine has been the staple of Cape Coral providing championship golf and a host of dining and social activities for its members and guests.

Our championship golf course designed by renowned architect, Arthur Hills, provides a fair yet challenging test of golf for players of all abilities from one of our eight sets of tees. In addition, our greens are known as some of the best in the area, smooth and fast!

Our Team - Palmetto Hills Golf Club Skip to primary navigation Skip to main content Palmetto Hills Golf Club Facebook Member Login Online Store Home Course Tee Times Membership Events Upcoming Events Special Events Contact Contact Us Join E-Club Our Team Advertisement Our Team Gage Bolden General Manager – Palmetto Hills Golf Club gbolden@palmettohillsgolfclub.com Gage Bolden A native of North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, Gage Bolden carries on a legacy nearly 50 years in the making. His grandfather built the original course in 1979 under the name The Widowmaker, and in 2020, the family had the opportunity to bring the property back into the family’s care. After graduating from The Citadel, The Military College of South Carolina in 2017 with a degree in Criminal Justice, Gage began a career in law enforcement with the Horry County Sheriff’s Office and later worked as a private investigator across South Carolina, North Carolina, Georgia, and Texas. But golf and family heritage called him back. In March of 2022, Gage officially stepped in as the General Manager of Palmetto Hills Golf Club, LLC, overseeing the course’s ongoing development, operations, and community revival with a deep sense of purpose and pride. Outside of the course, Gage is a newlywed to his wife Allie, the Varsity Competition Cheer Coach at Dorman High School. They live locally with their two dogs—Maverick, an Australian Shepherd, and Bowen, a friendly Bernedoodle—who can occasionally be spotted greeting golfers around the property. At Palmetto Hills, Gage combines his professional discipline, family values, and vision for the future to ensure every golfer feels welcome and part of something special.
